alert.note: Alert for Cascade Foothills in Lane County; Central Coast Range of Western Oregon; Central Oregon Coast; Central Willamette Valley; Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Greater Portland Metro Area; Lower Columbia; North Oregon Coast; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills; South Willamette Valley; Western Columbia River Gorge (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 26 at 8:23AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...Potential for Urban and Creek Flooding Tuesday... ...Rises on Coastal and Willamette Basin rivers Tuesday and Wednesday... Heavy rain expected across Southwest Washington and Northwest Oregon tonight and Tuesday will bring a threat of flooding to urban areas and flood-prone creeks and rivers. Precipitation totals expected to be 3 to 5 inches at the Coast Range and Coast Range, Willapa Hills; with 1 to 3 inches for the interior lowlands. The heaviest rain will likely occur late tonight as a strong front moves through the region. Snow levels will be as high as 7000 feet during the bulk of the heavy precipitation. Precipitation rates will decrease Tuesday afternoon. In the Western Gorge, melting snow and ice along with heavy rain may result in minor flooding issues through Tuesday night. For the details of timing, amounts and specific watersheds affected are uncertain. Visit weather.gov/Portland to get the latest weather and river forecasts.
